problem_text:
Consider the group B = ⟨a, b | (bab−1)a(bab−1)−1 = a2⟩ introduced by Baumslag in 1969. The same relation is satisfied by the functions f(x) = 2x and g(x) = 2x under the operation of composition in the group of germs of monotonically increasing to ∞ continuous functions on (0, ∞), where two functions are identified if they coincide for all sufficiently large arguments. Is the representation a → f, b → g of the group B faithful?
A. Yu. Olshanskii
